Hey, I wrote a simple utility tactic that logs the conclusion of the main goal.

However, simply using:

elab "show_goal" : tactic => do
  Lean.logInfo f!"{‚ÜêPrettyPrinter.ppExpr (‚ÜêgetMainTarget)}"

doesn't quite work in cases where a unique identifier is internally assigned to a variable, e.g.

example : False := by
  have : ‚àÉ x : Nat, x = default := ‚ü®default, rfl‚ü©
  rcases this with ‚ü®w, h‚ü©
  revert h
  show_goal -- _uniq.643157 = default ‚Üí False

The infoview itself says w = default ‚Üí False, which is what I would like to print.
I understand this information is available in LocalContext and I've tried something to the effect of:

elab "show_goal" : tactic => do
  let decl ‚Üê getMainDecl
  let ldecls := decl.lctx.decls
  for ldecl in ldecls do
    Lean.logInfo f!"name: {ldecl.get!.userName}"

This does reveal that the name w, which is what I would now like to substitute _uniq.643157 for.

Is there a simple way to match these _uniqnames to userName so I can replace them?
Or is there a much simpler approach that would allow me to log exactly what's in the infoview?

Try

elab "show_goal" : tactic => withMainContext do
  Lean.logInfo f!"{‚ÜêPrettyPrinter.ppExpr (‚ÜêgetMainTarget)}"
Franti≈°ek Silv√°≈°i ü¶â has marked this topic as resolved.
Because I'm in a good mood, I'll give you my trick to look like a meta-programming god: whenever someone asks a meta-programming question, answer "Didn't you forget a withMainContext?".
And if that doesn't work, consult the mathlib4 wiki page Metaprogramming Gotchas and choose another gotcha at random to ask if they forgot to consider :-)

I forgot I was looking at an old thread -- I was researching how often we have questions about _uniq.???. While I'm here, I have a tentative PR (lean4#3380) for pretty printing loose fvars as _fvar.123 rather than _uniq.123.

Do we think that would be an improvement to help with debugging? Are there other ideas for a design?
I honestly had no idea that _uniq was referring to free variables before someone pointed it out, so yes I think that's an improvement.

Other ideas are _fvar._uniq.123 or _loose_fvar.123

Or maybe _you_are_forgetting_withMainContext._fvar.123 :wink:

I'll take the last one as well, please and thank you.
I do think _uniq doesn't really tell me much beyond 'Lean chose a unique name'.
